recentTweets.text:
Another bug submitted by a user, that I just copy pasted into Cursor and then immediately fixed

I think I need to create an automated workflow that pulls bugs reported from my 
@featurebase
 bug board, then sends them into Cursor/AI etc, to immediately fix it, then do a pull request that I can then check

Fully automated AI bug fixing workflow will be the standard I think

And then my daily work will just be checking the AI's pull requests and approve or reject

Interesting to follow 

Because rich people going to space actually helps pay for the research and development that makes space cheaper for the next tier of people who can then afford it

And that will keep going on until everyone can go to space

The same exact thing happened with air travel from 1930 to today

I agree with all of this except set an alarm

I'd say never set an alarm

One of the reasons I still look relatively young is 100% because I was able to stop using an alarm about 12 years ago after graduating uni I think

My dad's a cardiologist and alarms cause a giant jump in blood pressure

Instant jolt of stress and cortisol, also it cuts off your sleep

You should awake naturally when your body had enough sleep

Of course life gets in the way, but being a business owner, you can set your own times and awake when you're fully rested

Harder with kids but must be possible too

You already have all the knowledge

Make a site today and add a Stripe button

The API gates are... open!

You can now try the 2 new 
@DataFast_
 API endpoints:

1. Create goals (newsletter signup, onboarding completed, etc.)
2. Get visitor data to know their identity, activity, and predicted conversion rate (revenue attribution required)

You can use the 2nd endpoint to update your landing page and increase revenue:

ü•µ Visitor high likely to convert? Create urgency or exclusivity
ü•∂ Cold visitor? Show a lead magnet or coupon

I opened the gates. What you do next is up to you.

How to grow an audience with ChatGPT's latest update:

1.  Ask: "What makes me special based on all our chats?"
2. Build a personal brand around that ONE thing.

AI knows you so well (if you use it often) that it will find what makes you different. This is what you need in 2025 to grow an audience: Be unique, be different, be you.

If I follow what society tells me, I'd have to wait until I turn 70 to retire, have free time, no boss, no worries about money.

70 years old... No fucking way.

People say entrepreneurship is hard and risky. True. Nothing happened to me for 7 years. But like most entrepreneurs who push through void and silence, the dots have connected and I should be retired before I turn 40.

Bet on yourself.

How to live a happy life in two simple steps:

1. Be an optimist.
2. Hang out with optimists.

What you believe, see, and hear becomes your reality.
